    WORK CONTACT

Yard Sales!

// a Lab project at Media Design Practices, ArtCenter College of Design

Year 2014
Client Personal
Role Designer, Researcher
Collaborators Kristen Schlott, Shan Shen
Mentor Luke Johnson


In an attempt to better understand the suburban area Whittier and Pico Rivera, LA, we chose to investigate its yard sale culture, which has a uniquely prominent presence. Between the two towns, there are easily ten yard sales every weekend. During our repeated visits carried out over an one month period, we captured data from 24 independent household yard sales in detail. We began to notice an intimate relationship between the sales and the house.

Process

We counted approximately 3000 countable items, 1000 kinds of items, and classified them into 140 categories. While studying every yard sale, we tried to collect as much information as possible, specifically paying attention to the stories associated with the mundane and unique objects. There were many interesting stories, highlighting the multifaceted quality of people and their living.

Photo stream of interesting yard sale items and their corresponding houses.


Through online resources such as Google Maps and Trulia, we were able to obtain an uncomfortable amount of information about the house and its inhabitants, including the value of the property and number of people in the household. The idea of comparing the volume of the house and volume of the sale starts to emerge.

Data visualization of the number of items in the categories in connection to the household. The larger dot indicates the category is more common.

from Shixie. 2015
